cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes visualized as concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. The Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: Cosmic Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively).

alternateConfigurations.name: Vertical Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below.

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane, where all four elements churn in chaos; an Overheaven, where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld, where evil deities and Fiends reside.

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it.

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Abyss
planes.philosophicalEssence: The Abyss embodies all that is perverse, gruesome, and chaotic.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Corruption and moral decay affect visitors.

temperature.description: Varies by layer, from scorching to frigid.

layers.name: The Plain of Infinite Portals
layers.description: On layer 1, corroded iron fortresses defend routes to lower layers. Under a glaring red sun, the rocky ground contains gaping craters that are portals to the other layers of the Abyss.

notableLocations.name: Broken Reach
notableLocations.description: A fortress containing the portal leading to Plague-Mort, ruled by a succubus named Red Shroud. Those who prove their strength can stay unharmed for a few days.

layers.name: Azzagrat
layers.description: Graz'zt's corrupt, decadent city is split across layers 45, 46, and 47. Its bustling markets and pleasure palaces draw visitors from across the multiverse.

notableLocations.name: Argent Palace
notableLocations.description: Graz'zt's seat of power in the city of Zelatar.

notableLocations.name: Zelatar
notableLocations.description: A city whose bustling markets and pleasure palaces draw visitors seeking obscure magical lore and perverse delights.

ruler.name: Graz'zt
ruler.title: Demon Lord
ruler.description: Embodies manipulation and cruelty, tempting mortals with the promise of appalling delights and decadent luxuries.

layers.name: The Demonweb
layers.description: On layer 66, Lolth's web snares all and hides portals to other planes. An immense network of thick, magical webbing forms passageways and cocoon-like chambers.

notableLocations.name: Demonweb Pits
notableLocations.description: Bottomless pits where the Spider Queen dwells with her most loyal servants—yochlol demons.

ruler.name: Lolth
ruler.title: Demon Queen of Spiders
ruler.description: Her schemes entangle entire civilizations on worlds across the multiverse. Of all demon lords, she has the most active interest in the Material Plane.

layers.name: The Gaping Maw
layers.description: Layer 88 is a malevolent wilderness surrounding Demogorgon's ocean fortress. A massive primeval continent covered in dense jungle, surrounded by endless ocean and brine flats.

notableLocations.name: Abysm
notableLocations.description: Demogorgon's fortress of two serpentine towers topped with enormous fanged skulls, rising from a turbid sea. Echoes of his turbulent thoughts tear at the minds of creatures who enter.

ruler.name: Demogorgon
ruler.title: Prince of Demons
ruler.description: The Sibilant Beast, a two-headed monster who yearns for nothing less than undoing the order of the multiverse.

layers.name: Thanatos
layers.description: On layer 113, an endless graveyard hosts Orcus and the sleepless dead. A land of bleak mountains, barren moors, ruined cities, and forests of twisted black trees under a black sky.

notableLocations.name: Everlost
notableLocations.description: A vast palace crafted of obsidian and bone, set in a howling wasteland called Oblivion's End.

notableLocations.name: Oblivion's End
notableLocations.description: A howling wasteland surrounding the palace, with tombs and graves in tiered necropolis.

ruler.name: Orcus
ruler.title: Demon Prince of Undeath
ruler.description: Known as the Blood Lord, a brooding and nihilistic entity who yearns to make the multiverse a place of death and despair.

layers.name: The Slime Pits
layers.description: Layer 222, a fetid realm of ooze and fungi, obeys the whims of Juiblex and Zuggtmoy. A bubbling morass of fetid sludge with vast expanses of caustic slimes.

notableLocations.name: Zuggtmoy's Palace
notableLocations.description: Two dozen immense mushrooms hollowed into grand chambers and twisting corridors, surrounded by acidic puffballs and poisonous vapors.

ruler.name: Juiblex
ruler.title: Demon Lord of Slimes and Oozes
ruler.description: An amorphous mass, the Faceless Lord whose sole desire is to turn all creatures into formless copies of itself.

layers.name: The Death Dells
layers.description: Yeenoghu and his gnoll servants prowl layer 422—a cruel, desolate realm of ravines and badlands where creatures must hunt to survive.

ruler.name: Yeenoghu
ruler.title: Gnoll Lord
ruler.description: Hungers for slaughter and senseless destruction. Gnolls are his instruments on the Material Plane.

layers.name: The Endless Maze
layers.description: Layer 600's endless labyrinth turns visitors into Baphomet's prey. A never-ending dungeon with the Horned King's enormous palace at its center.

notableLocations.name: Baphomet's Palace
notableLocations.description: An enormous palace at the center of the labyrinth, a confusing jumble of crooked hallways and myriad chambers surrounded by a mile-wide moat concealing submerged stairs and tunnels.

ruler.name: Baphomet
ruler.title: Horned King, Prince of Beasts
ruler.description: Embodies bestial bloodlust. Would see civilization crumble and all mortals embrace their predatory instincts.

hazards.name: Abyssal Corruption
hazards.description: The corruption of the Abyss affects visitors. Its virtually endless layers spiral downward into ever more appalling forms, and the plane seems to be in a decaying, crumbling, or corroded state.

portals.name: Craters of the Plain of Infinite Portals
portals.destination: Other layers of the Abyss, Pandemonium, Sigil, Plague-Mort, Astral Plane

notableEntities.name: Juiblex
notableEntities.title: Demon Lord of Slimes and Oozes

adventureThemes: Confronting the evil in one's own heart
Resisting temptation to turn against allies
Desperate last stand against endless hordes
Avoiding detection while seeking holy relics
Contamination spreading to other planes

planes.name: Acheron
planes.philosophicalEssence: Enforced order where rigid conformity leads to crushed spirits and broken hopes.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Instills bloodlust in visitors.

physicalProperties.shape: Immense iron blocks drifting through an airy void, sometimes colliding.

layers.name: Avalas
layers.description: Spirit soldiers wage endless wars across debris-strewn battlefields. The largest blocks gravitate here.

layers.name: Thuldanin
layers.description: Pitted, hollow cubes are filled with the cast-off machinery of war.

layers.name: Tintibulus
layers.description: Jagged blocks tumble in darkness, holding frozen memories sapped by the River Styx and crystallized into fleeting images.

layers.name: Ocanthus
layers.description: Maelstroms of razor-sharp debris swirl above a mire of black ice. Tiny shards break off and are gradually assembled into the perfect cubes of Avalas.

hazards.name: Colliding Iron Blocks
hazards.description: Immense iron blocks sometimes collide, crushing all between them and sending shudders through the plane.

hazards.name: Bloodlust
hazards.description: The nature of Acheron instills bloodlust in those who visit the plane.

adventureThemes: Confrontation with bleak nihilism of unending conflict
Harsh reality of authoritarian rule
Pressures of social conformity
What are you fighting for?
Scavenging Thuldanin for horrors of warfare
Retrieving secrets from imprisoned thoughts in Tintibulus

planes.name: Arborea
planes.philosophicalEssence: A plane of extremes: wild emotion, violent moods, deep affections, whim backed by steel, and passions that blaze brightly.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Air charged with excitement; music always seems to be playing in the distance.

temperature.description: Warm with sudden squalls that pass within minutes.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Sudden squalls brew up out of nowhere, beating tree-lined paths with heavy winds, passing within minutes to leave warm sunlight.

layers.name: Arvandor
layers.description: Towering trees, colorful wildflowers, abundant grain, and delicious fruit create a lush environment.

layers.name: Aquallor
layers.description: An eternal ocean fed by the River Oceanus is home to teeming sea life and mighty storms.

layers.name: Mithardir
layers.description: A desert of white sand is abandoned by whatever powers once lived there.

environmentalEffects.name: Yearning to Return
environmentalEffects.description: Creatures that visit Arborea and then leave sometimes experience a desperate desire to return—a yearning so intense that it can interfere with day-to-day life.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: DM-adjudicated intense yearning to return to Arborea after leaving.
environmentalEffects.emotionalEffect: Desperate desire to return to Arborea.

adventureThemes: Discovering identity when masks fall away
Emotional honesty
Exploring secrets buried in Mithardir's sands

planes.name: Arcadia
planes.philosophicalEssence: Thrives with perfect order, geometrically pleasing shapes, and immaculate landscapes dedicated to the common good.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Individuality is subsumed to peaceful life in community.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Governed by four allied demigods called the Storm Kings: the Cloud King, the Wind Queen, the Lightning King, and the Rain Queen.

layers.name: Abellio
layers.description: Everything in these fields of plenty is dedicated to the good of all.

layers.name: Buxenus
layers.description: Military forces gather their strength, amid pleasant valleys and orchards, to reclaim the lost layer of Menausus—now part of Mechanus.

environmentalEffects.name: Vigorous Life Energy
environmentalEffects.description: Arcadia is suffused with a vigorous life energy that bestows great vitality on visitors.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Bestows great vitality on visitors (see Chapter 3).

adventureThemes: Tension between individual freedom and societal responsibility
Conformity versus individuality
planes.physicalProperties.dayNightCycle: An orb floats in the sky above both layers. Half radiates sunlight (day), the other half sheds moonlight (starry night). Rotates evenly without fail.

planes.name: Astral Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: A realm of thought and dream, where visitors travel as disembodied souls to reach the Outer Planes.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Thought-based existence; psychic storms can affect mental state.

physicalProperties.shape: A great silvery sea with swirling wisps of white and gray streaking among motes of light.
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: No hunger, thirst, or aging occur on the Astral Plane.

timeFlow.description: Creatures on the Astral Plane don't age or suffer from hunger or thirst.

hazards.name: Psychic Wind
hazards.description: A storm of thought made of lost memories, forgotten ideas, and subconscious fears. First sensed as rapid darkening of the silver-gray sky. After 1d4 minutes, darkness like a moonless night. Buffeting and shaking felt. Passes within 1 minute.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Each traveler caught in a psychic wind makes a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw.

onFailure.description: Suffers a random psychic effect from the Psychic Wind Psychic Effects table.

detectionMethod.warningDescription: A rapid darkening of the silver-gray sky is first sensed. After 1d4 minutes, the area becomes as dark as a moonless night.

entries.description: At the end of the travel time, the characters arrive at a location other than the intended destination.
Sent through a random color pool (roll on the Astral Color Pools table).

entries.durationDescription: 1 minute; repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on yourself on a success.
5 (1d10) hours; the effect ends if you take damage or if another creature takes an action to shake you awake.

encounterProbability.description: Occurs during Astral travel; frequency at DM discretion.

portals.name: Astral Color Pools
portals.colorOrAppearance: Two-dimensional pools of rippling colors, understood rather than seen.

civilizations.name: Tu'narath
civilizations.description: Perhaps the most infamous city built on a dead god's petrified remains.
civilizations.location: Petrified remains of a dead god

specialRules.name: Astral Movement
specialRules.description: A traveler in the Astral Plane can move by simply thinking about moving. In combat, a creature has a Fly Speed (in feet) equal to 5 times its Intelligence score and can hover.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Fly Speed (ft) = 5 × Intelligence score. Can hover. Outside combat, distance is meaningless and navigation is by thought.

specialRules.name: Astral Navigation
specialRules.description: Thinking about a destination makes the creature aware of the most direct route to that location. The creature doesn't know travel time or peril, just direction.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Thinking about a destination reveals direction. Travel to specific location: 4d6 days. Travel to general location: 1d4 × 10 hours.

specialRules.name: No Aging or Sustenance
specialRules.description: Creatures on the Astral Plane don't age or suffer from hunger or thirst. Githyanki establish outposts on other planes so their children can grow.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: No aging, no hunger, no thirst while on the Astral Plane.

adventureThemes: Traveling to Outer Planes or other worlds
Encountering fellow travelers (Celestials, Fiends, slaadi, modrons, githyanki)
Plumbing crystallized thoughts of dead gods
Sifting information from psychic winds
Facing Astral manifestations of own memories, fears, and dreams

crossReferences.description: Contains extensive information about Wildspace and Astral travel.

planes.name: Beastlands
planes.philosophicalEssence: Nature unbound, embodying nature's wildness and beauty and the animal within all living creatures.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Visitors feel invigorated—minds more alert, reflexes sharpened, strides quickened. Hunger pangs acute but food and drink taste better. Sleep is always deep and restful.

temperature.description: Ranges from eternal summer noon (Krigala) to eternal night (Karasuthra).

layers.name: Krigala
layers.description: The River Oceanus is a strong torrent flowing through this wilderness of eternal summer noon.

layers.name: Brux
layers.description: A red sun hovers forever on the horizon as mists and streams roil through the trees in eternal twilight.

layers.name: Karasuthra
layers.description: A pale moon provides the only light in this wilderness of eternal night.

hazards.name: Beast Slayer Shapeshift
hazards.description: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane, the slayer must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or shape-shift into the type of Beast that was slain. The creature's game statistics are replaced by the Beast's stat block, but the creature retains its alignment, personality, creature type, Intelligence score, and ability to speak. At the end of each Long Rest, the shape-shifted creature repeats the save. On a successful save, the creature returns to its true form. After three failed saves, the transformation can be undone only by a Remove Curse spell or similar magic.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane.

onFailure.description: Shape-shift into the type of Beast that was slain. Game statistics replaced by Beast's stat block. Retains alignment, personality, creature type, Intelligence score, and ability to speak.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: After three failed saves, the transformation can be undone only by a Remove Curse spell or similar magic.
onFailure.terminalEffect: Transformation becomes permanent unless removed by Remove Curse or similar magic.

savingThrowToTraverse.repeatSaveTiming: At the end of each Long Rest.

adventureThemes: Valuing the physical nature of life
Conflict with those who dismiss animals as inferior
Wild, beautiful nature and vibrant power of life

planes.name: Bytopia
planes.philosophicalEssence: The heaven of productive work and the satisfaction of a job well done, embodying personal achievement alongside social interdependence.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Goodness creates feelings of goodwill and happiness.

physicalProperties.shape: Two layers face each other like the covers of a closed book, about a mile apart.

layers.name: Dothion
layers.description: Farms nestled among well-tamed woods are hubs of pastoral activity and individual industry. Rewards those who seek a quiet life.

layers.name: Shurrock
layers.description: Small communities thrive around quarries and mills amid rough country and harsh weather. The paradise of those who continually challenge and better themselves.

adventureThemes: Impact of actions mirrored across layers
Recognizing consequences of deeds
Personal achievement vs. social interdependence

planes.name: Carceri
planes.philosophicalEssence: The grim inspiration for all other prisons in existence, a plane of desolation and despair holding traitors and backstabbers.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Despair, passions and poisons, hatreds that run deep.

temperature.description: Ranges from bogs to black ice across six layers.

layers.name: Orthrys
layers.description: The River Styx meanders through a layer of vast bogs and quicksand.

layers.name: Cathrys
layers.description: The stench of decay hangs over fetid jungles and scarlet plains.

layers.name: Minethys
layers.description: Stinging sand blows in unending storms, hiding the ruins of the ancient city Payratheon.

notableLocations.name: Payratheon
notableLocations.description: Ruins of an ancient city hidden by unending sandstorms.

layers.name: Colothys
layers.description: Deep chasms cut between cruel mountains make foot travel nearly impossible.

layers.name: Porphatys
layers.description: Cold, acidic oceans are fed by constant black snow.

layers.name: Agathys
layers.description: Black ice streaked with red covers this frigid realm.

escapeMethods: Secret passages (hidden, guarded by traps and monsters)
River Styx (extremely dangerous, ferries rare and expensive)
blockedSpells: All spells that attempt to leave the plane
prisonRules.portalBehavior: Portals and gates that open onto the plane become one-way only.
prisonRules.escapeRequirement: Prisoners can escape only by becoming stronger than whatever force imprisoned them there.

adventureThemes: Forces that keep characters trapped
Spiritual and psychological imprisonment
Helping unjustly held prisoners escape
Despair and betrayal preventing cooperation

planes.name: Demiplanes
planes.philosophicalEssence: Extradimensional spaces with their own physical laws, shaped by their creator's will.

notableEntities.name: Strahd von Zarovich
notableEntities.title: Vampire Lord of Barovia
notableEntities.description: The land of Barovia exists entirely within a demiplane under his sway.

adventureThemes: Exploring how one would shape reality
Confronting distortions of reality crafted by villains

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Air
planes.philosophicalEssence: Movement, animation, and inspiration. The breath of life, the winds of change.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Mild air except near Para-elemental Planes where temperature is more extreme.

temperature.description: Mild, except near Para-elemental Planes where temperature is extreme.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Storms frequent, ranging from strong thunderstorms to fierce tornadoes or mighty hurricanes.

notableEntities.name: Wind Dukes of Aaqa
notableEntities.title: Lords of Aaqa
notableEntities.description: Dedicated to law and good, maintain vigilant watch against Elemental Evil. Served by aarakocra.

civilizations.name: Aaqa
civilizations.description: A shining domain of silver spires and verdant gardens atop a fertile earth mote, reachable only by following a particular sequence of flowing winds.

domainsOrRegions.name: Aaqa
domainsOrRegions.description: A shining domain of silver spires and verdant gardens atop a fertile earth mote.

domainsOrRegions.name: Labyrinth Winds
domainsOrRegions.description: A complex web of air streams, currents, and winds ranging from stiff breezes to howling gales.

domainsOrRegions.name: Mistral Reach
domainsOrRegions.description: Near the Para-elemental Plane of Ice, a region of frigid winds and driving snowstorms.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sirocco Straits
domainsOrRegions.description: Nearest to the Para-elemental Plane of Ash, where hot, dry winds scour earth motes into barren rock.

adventureThemes: Elemental Evil—destructive power turned to vengeful ends
Cultists wielding howling storms

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Earth
planes.philosophicalEssence: Stability, rigidity, stern resolve, and tradition.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: No air surrounds the peaks of highest mountains. Most visitors arrive via vast caverns.

civilizations.name: City of Jewels
civilizations.description: Capital city of the dao in the Great Dismal Delve / Sevenfold Mazework. Every building made from precious stones and metals. Protected by a spell that alerts the population if a visitor steals even a single stone.

domainsOrRegions.name: City of Jewels
domainsOrRegions.description: Capital of the dao. Every building made from precious stones and metals. Protected by a theft-detection spell.

domainsOrRegions.name: Furnaces
domainsOrRegions.description: Mountains nearest the Para-elemental Plane of Magma. Lava seeps through caverns; dao have forges and smelting furnaces.

domainsOrRegions.name: Mud Hills
domainsOrRegions.description: Abutting the Para-elemental Plane of Ooze. Landslides wear away slopes; the plane regenerates the land.

adventureThemes: Elemental Evil—implacable force of destruction
Cultists craving power to destroy civilization with landslides, sinkholes, earthquakes

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Fire
planes.philosophicalEssence: Vibrancy, passion, and change. The light of inspiration, warmth of compassion, flame of desire.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Breathable but creatures must cover mouths and eyes to avoid stinging cinders.

temperature.description: Heat comparable to a hot desert on the Material Plane.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Fierce winds and thick ash. Wind always blows, sometimes hurricane force.

hazards.name: Extreme Heat
hazards.description: The heat on the Plane of Fire is comparable to a hot desert on the Material Plane and poses a similar threat to travelers.

hazards.name: Cinder Storms
hazards.description: Thick ash obscures sight and stinging cinders require creatures to cover mouths and eyes.

notableEntities.name: Torchy
notableEntities.title: Proprietor of Torchy's Tavern
notableEntities.description: A sentient Flame Tongue mace that runs a tavern on a basalt crag.

civilizations.name: City of Brass
civilizations.description: The fabled city of the efreet on the shores of the Sea of Fire. Ornate spires and spiked walls. The heart is the Charcoal Palace where the tyrannical emperor reigns.
civilizations.location: Shores of the Sea of Fire

domainsOrRegions.name: Cinder Wastes
domainsOrRegions.description: Great expanse of black cinders and embers crossed by rivers of lava. Roving bands of salamanders, obsidian ruins.

domainsOrRegions.name: City of Brass
domainsOrRegions.description: The fabled city of the efreet, standing on the shores of the Sea of Fire. If it's possible to buy magic items in your campaign, the City of Brass is the most likely place to find any item for sale.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Fire
domainsOrRegions.description: Great expanse of lava traversed by efreeti and azer sailors in great brass ships. Islands of obsidian and basalt with ancient ruins and red dragon lairs.

domainsOrRegions.name: Torchy's
domainsOrRegions.description: An iron-walled tavern built atop a tall basalt crag, most easily reached by hot-air balloon.

adventureThemes: Quests for legendary magic in City of Brass
Trading in favors with efreet
Cults of Evil Fire seeking volcanic destruction

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Water
planes.philosophicalEssence: Flow, rhythm of the tide, nectar of life, bitter tears of mourning, balm of sympathy and healing.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Endless sea; air breathers need land above the surface or magical means.

temperature.description: Ranges from warm sunlit seas to frigid Sea of Ice.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: If not calm, battered by storms. Several rain deluges daily with spectacular lightning. Rare rogue waves.

notableEntities.name: Emperor of the Marids
notableEntities.title: Nominal Emperor
notableEntities.description: Dwells in the Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls. Mood as changeable as the sea.

civilizations.name: Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls
civilizations.description: Opulent palace of coral studded with pearls, centerpiece of the Sea of Light.

domainsOrRegions.name: Darkened Depths
domainsOrRegions.description: Deeper extents where no sunlight reaches. Absolute cold and crushing pressure. Krakens and mighty leviathans.

domainsOrRegions.name: Isle of Dread
domainsOrRegions.description: Connected to Material Plane by a storm. Ships from different worlds wrecked on rocks. Settlements of stranded sailors' descendants.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Ice
domainsOrRegions.description: Bordering Para-elemental Plane of Ice. Frigid water choked with icebergs and sheet ice.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Light
domainsOrRegions.description: Upper sunlit waters where life flourishes. Aquatic peoples craft castles in coral reefs.

domainsOrRegions.name: Silt Flats
domainsOrRegions.description: Nearest Para-elemental Plane of Ooze. Water thick with soil and sludge, turning to muddy ground.

adventureThemes: Elemental Evil—erosive power of water
Cultists believing seas want to reclaim water from living creatures

planes.name: Elysium
planes.philosophicalEssence: Home to creatures of unfettered kindness. The embodiment of goodness where evil can't abide.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Tranquility and contentment seep into bones and souls. The longer a visitor remains, the less reason they find to ever leave.

layers.name: Amoria
layers.description: Small towns on the banks of the River Oceanus, surrounded by lush meadows, are among the most hospitable refuges on the Outer Planes.

layers.name: Eronia
layers.description: Steep hills, craggy mountains, and white granite valleys offer a rugged home for hardy souls.

layers.name: Belierin
layers.description: Lighthouses pierce the fog and form hubs for small communities amid sprawling marshlands. Said to be the prison of some deadly creature.

layers.name: Thalasia
layers.description: The Heroic Isles, rising from the headwaters of the River Oceanus, hold the best departed souls.

notableLocations.name: Heroic Isles
notableLocations.description: Islands in the headwaters of the River Oceanus that hold the best departed souls.

adventureThemes: Temptation to rest from labors
Seeking ancient spirits on Heroic Isles
Mysterious prisoner in Belierin
Challenge to devotion to doing good

planes.name: Ethereal Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: A misty, fog-bound dimension whose shores overlap the Material Plane, Feywild, Shadowfell, and Inner Planes.

hazards.name: Ether Cyclone
hazards.description: A serpentine column that spins through the plane, distorting and uprooting everything in its path. Travelers with Passive Perception 15 or higher receive 1 minute of warning: a deep thrum in the ethereal matter.

detectionMethod.warningDescription: A deep thrum in the ethereal matter.

entries.description: Each character makes a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. If at least half the group succeeds, travel is delayed by 1d10 hours. Otherwise, journey travel time is doubled.
Blown to a random location in the Border Ethereal overlapping a random plane (roll on the Ethereal Curtains table).
Hurled to a random destination on the Astral Plane.

portals.name: Ethereal Curtains
portals.colorOrAppearance: Curtains of vaporous color in the Deep Ethereal.

civilizations.name: Radiant Citadel
civilizations.description: A living relic of 27 great civilizations, carved from a single massive fossil around the Auroral Diamond gemstone. A nexus of diplomacy and trade, a thriving sanctuary. Orbited by 15 Concord Jewels that provide transportation to founding civilizations' homes.

specialRules.name: Border Ethereal Rules
specialRules.description: From the Border Ethereal, a traveler can see into the overlapped plane (grayish, indistinct, visibility 30 ft into it). Visibility in Border Ethereal is 60 ft. Creatures are imperceptible to those on overlapped plane. Solid objects on overlapped plane don't hamper movement. Exceptions: magical effects (including force) and living beings.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Visibility 60 ft in Ethereal. 30 ft into overlapped plane. Imperceptible to overlapped plane creatures. Can move through solid non-magical, non-living objects. Disobeys laws of gravity; free movement in any direction.

specialRules.name: Deep Ethereal Travel
specialRules.description: Travel through the Deep Ethereal takes 1d10 × 10 hours from one curtain to another, regardless of origin and destination. In combat, creatures move at normal speeds.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Travel time: 1d10 × 10 hours between curtains. Combat movement is normal.

domainsOrRegions.name: Radiant Citadel
domainsOrRegions.description: A floating city carved from a single massive fossil snaking around the Auroral Diamond. A nexus of diplomacy, trade, and sanctuary. Orbited by 15 Concord Jewels. Protected from the Keening Gloom ether cyclone.

adventureThemes: Traveling between planes
Skirting Material Plane obstacles
Exploring new worlds from Radiant Citadel

crossReferences.description: An anthology of short adventures exploring worlds accessible from the Radiant Citadel.

planes.name: Far Realm
planes.philosophicalEssence: Outside the known multiverse. Might be an entirely separate universe with its own physical and magical laws. Entities too alien for mortal minds.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Knowledge of the Far Realm is a struggle of the mind to overcome boundaries of matter, space, and rational thought.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Entirely alien physical and magical laws.

adventureThemes: What it means to be a person
Mental and bodily autonomy
Whether mortals have any control over their fate
Importance of mortals in the grand scheme

planes.name: Feywild
planes.philosophicalEssence: A land of soft lights and wonder, music and magic. Responds to unfettered emotion. Gives physical expression to powerful emotion and excels at metaphor.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The plane responds to emotion: flowers tremble near heated arguments, grass withers under malice, birds chirp merrily near joy.

warpTable.effectDescription: Time spent as days in the Feywild passes as only minutes elsewhere.
Time spent as days in the Feywild passes as only hours elsewhere.
Time spent as days in the Feywild passes as weeks elsewhere.
Time spent as days in the Feywild passes as months elsewhere.
Time spent as days in the Feywild passes as years elsewhere.

timeFlow.description: Time and distance are mutable. After spending at least 1 day, time warp may occur on leaving. A Wish spell can remove the effect on up to 10 creatures.

hazards.name: Feywild Memory Loss
hazards.description: A creature that leaves the Feywild makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature remembers nothing from its time in the Feywild. On a successful save, memories remain intact but are a little hazy.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: When a creature leaves the Feywild.

onFailure.description: The creature remembers nothing from its time spent in the Feywild.

onSuccess.description: The creature's memories remain intact but are a little hazy.

recoveryMethods: Any spell that can end a curse

hazards.name: Feywild Time Warp
hazards.description: After spending at least 1 day on the Feywild, upon leaving, time may have passed differently. Roll on the Feywild Time Warp table (d20). A Wish spell can remove the effect on up to 10 creatures.

requirement.description: Most fey crossings open infrequently: during a full moon, at dawn on a particular day, or for someone carrying a certain type of item. Can be closed permanently if land on either side is dramatically altered.

notableEntities.name: Yarnspinner
notableEntities.title: Archfey of Fablerise
notableEntities.description: A story-spinning spider archfey who loves reading stories to animals.

notableEntities.name: Zybilna
notableEntities.title: Archfey of Prismeer
notableEntities.description: Regarded as a fairy godmother on some worlds, granting wishes for the lost, forsaken, or betrayed.

domainsOrRegions.name: Fablerise
domainsOrRegions.description: A rambling thicket of twisted roots, thorny vines, and sinuous creepers weaving into tunnels, hallways, and domes.

domainsOrRegions.name: Gloaming Court
domainsOrRegions.description: A realm of twilight, fireflies, cobwebs, and autumn leaves with music of hooting owls and croaking frogs. Prizing intuitive and instinctual behavior.

domainsOrRegions.name: Prismeer
domainsOrRegions.description: A large domain encompassing Hither (vast swamp), Thither (ancient forest), and Yon (stormy mountains). Palace of Heart's Desire at center.

domainsOrRegions.name: Summer Court
domainsOrRegions.description: The most settled and pastoral domain, wrapped in perpetual summer. Elegant clothing, elaborate ceremony, ritualized etiquette.

adventureThemes: Robbed of cherished memories embodied as objects
Stolen emotions made physical
Mischievous Fey stealing aspects of characters

crossReferences.description: Prismeer is detailed in this adventure.

planes.name: Gehenna
planes.philosophicalEssence: The plane of suspicion and greed, with no space for mercy or compassion.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Suspicion and greed pervade. No space for mercy or compassion.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Noxious fumes and searing flames from volcanic fissures.

temperature.description: From volcanic lava to freezing acidic ash across layers.

layers.name: Khalas
layers.description: Lava illuminates clouds of volcanic ash and steam from the River Styx.

notableLocations.name: Teardrop Palace
notableLocations.description: A bustling market crowded with Fiends and occasional mortal visitors, offering forbidden and sinister goods. Named for its teardrop shape that diverts lava flow.

layers.name: Chamada
layers.description: Constant lava flows and eruptions make overland travel difficult. Iron zeppelins piloted by yugoloths drift through constant gray ashfall.

notableLocations.name: Tower Arcane
notableLocations.description: A sinister structure adorned with blades and spikes, guarded by arcanaloths. Rumored to hold yugoloths' history and contract records.

layers.name: Mungoth
layers.description: Acidic ash mingles with falling snow on this freezing layer.

layers.name: Krangath
layers.description: A great mountain suspended in silence and darkness, home to a coterie of liches.

hazards.name: Steep Volcanic Terrain
hazards.description: The ground inclines at least 45 degrees almost everywhere. Steep cliffs and deep canyons present challenging obstacles. Volcanic fissures vent noxious fumes or searing flames.

hazards.name: Atmosphere of Suspicion
hazards.description: The plane instills suspicion and greed in visitors.

adventureThemes: Betrayal when tensions run high
Trust no one, perhaps not even each other
Yugoloths in disguise as people in need
Purchasing forbidden goods at Teardrop Palace
Infiltrating Tower Arcane for yugoloth secrets

planes.name: Hades
planes.philosophicalEssence: Places without joy, hope, or passion. Pure, undiluted evil as inescapable gravity dragging spirits down.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Leaches away color and emotion. Slowly kills dreams and desires, draining hope and optimism.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: No sun, moon, stars, or seasons.

layers.name: Oinos
layers.description: A land of dead-gray ash, stunted trees, and virulent disease is stalked by roving bands of Fiends looking for a fight or recruits for the Blood War.

layers.name: Niflheim
layers.description: Gray pine trees blanket rolling hills and rocky bluffs, and thick mists coil around their trunks.

layers.name: Pluton
layers.description: Shriveled willows, olive trees, and poplars contribute to the gloom of this concentration of the deepest despair in the multiverse.

hazards.name: Plane of Gloom
hazards.description: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane, a visitor makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while the creature is in Hades. If the creature reaches 6 Exhaustion levels, it doesn't die. Instead, it permanently transforms into a Larva, whereupon all Exhaustion levels afflicting the creature are removed.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane.

onFailure.description: The creature gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while the creature is in Hades.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: Each failed save adds 1 Exhaustion level. At 6 levels, permanent transformation occurs.
onFailure.terminalEffect: Permanently transforms into a Larva, all Exhaustion levels removed.

adventureThemes: Why bother? Confronting apathetic despair
Rekindling passion and purpose
Pursuing evil spellcasters collecting larvae
Risk of being trapped by overwhelming despair

planes.name: Limbo
planes.philosophicalEssence: Pure chaos, a roiling soup of impermanent matter and energy. Constant change is the defining characteristic.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Storm of intrusive thoughts and unruly emotions, forcing confrontation with the transient nature of identity.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Variable; pockets of different elements form and dissolve constantly.
physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Stone melts into water that freezes into metal, then turns into diamond that burns to smoke that becomes snow, endlessly.

civilizations.name: Githzerai Monasteries
civilizations.description: Githzerai build entire monasteries with their minds, creating order within the chaos.

specialRules.name: Move Object
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature in Limbo can make an Intelligence check to mentally move an object within 30 feet that isn't worn or carried. DC depends on size: Tiny DC 5, Small DC 10, Medium DC 15, Large DC 20, Huge or larger DC 25. On success, move the object 5 feet plus feet equal to how much the total exceeded the DC.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. Intelligence check. DC by size. Success: move object 5 + (check total - DC) feet.

interactionCheck.name: Move Object in Limbo
interactionCheck.description: Mentally move an unattended object within 30 feet.

onSuccess.description: Move the object 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to how much the total exceeded the DC.

specialRules.name: Alter Object
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make an Intelligence check to alter a nonmagical object within 30 feet that isn't worn or carried. DC by size: Tiny DC 10, Small DC 15, Medium DC 20, Large or larger DC 25. On success, change the object into another nonliving form of the same size.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. Intelligence check. DC by size. Success: transform object into another nonliving form of same size.

interactionCheck.name: Alter Object in Limbo
interactionCheck.description: Transform a nonmagical unattended object within 30 feet into another nonliving form of the same size.

onSuccess.description: Change the object into another nonliving form of the same size, such as turning a boulder into a ball of fire.
onSuccess.transformationConstraints: Must be another nonliving form of the same size.

specialRules.name: Stabilize Area
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make a DC 20 Intelligence check to stabilize an area within a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point it can see. On success, prevent the area from being altered by the plane for 24 hours or until the creature takes this Magic action again.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. DC 20 Intelligence check. Success: stabilize 30-ft radius Sphere for 24 hours or until used again.

interactionCheck.name: Stabilize Area in Limbo
interactionCheck.description: Prevent a 30-foot-radius Sphere from being altered by the plane.

onSuccess.description: Prevent the area from being altered by the plane for 24 hours or until the creature takes this Magic action again.

domainsOrRegions.name: Spawning Stone
domainsOrRegions.description: Said to have been created by Primus, the overlord of the modrons. Absorbs chaotic energy to make enclaves of order possible, but the absorbed energy creates slaadi.

adventureThemes: Asserting one's sense of self amid constant change
Githzerai monasteries as havens
Secrets of the Spawning Stone
Mastering internal landscape of chaos

planes.name: Material Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Where the philosophical and elemental forces collide in mortal life and matter. A thoroughly magical place.

notableEntities.name: Corellon
notableEntities.description: Planted and tended a seedling of Yggdrasil on the First World at the dawn of time.

adventureThemes: Foundation for most campaigns
Transit between worlds via Wildspace, Shadowfell, Feywild, or magic

planes.name: Mechanus
planes.philosophicalEssence: Perfectly regimented order. Law reflected in gigantic clockwork gears. Some say they are the clockwork of time; others that they uphold basic rules of the cosmos.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Individual consciousness subordinated to perfect order. 'I' subsumed into 'we.'

physicalProperties.shape: Gigantic clockwork gears interlocked and turning. Each cog has its own gravity pulling toward center.

temperature.description: Equal measures of light and dark, equal proportions of heat and cold.

notableEntities.name: Primus
notableEntities.title: Overlord of the Modrons
notableEntities.description: Creator of the modrons, dwelling in Regulus.

civilizations.name: Regulus
civilizations.description: The realm of Primus, creator of the modrons.

adventureThemes: Examining individual egos vs. the group
Setting aside personal goals for the group
Asserting individual identity

planes.name: Mount Celestia
planes.philosophicalEssence: The model of justice and order, celestial grace and endless mercy. Only the purest souls can reach the highest peak.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Pervasive goodness bestows blessings. Fills even the most jaded with awe.

physicalProperties.shape: A mountain rising from a shining Silver Sea to incomprehensible heights with seven plateaus.

temperature.description: Ranges from the Silver Sea to snowy slopes to ineffable heights.

layers.name: Lunia
layers.description: The holy water of the Silver Sea laps at the base of the celestial mountain under a starry sky.

layers.name: Mercuria
layers.description: Tame slopes and lush valleys are bathed in golden light that evokes the hope of a new dawn.

layers.name: Venya
layers.description: Terraced fields and tended woodlands dot the snowy slopes.

layers.name: Solania
layers.description: Holy shrines glitter under a silvery sky amid luminescent fog.

layers.name: Mertion
layers.description: On the sweeping plains, holy soldiers muster in grand citadels for battles across the planes.

notableLocations.name: Empyrea
notableLocations.description: A city on the edge of a clear lake renowned for the healing power of its fountains and springs. Pilgrims from across the planes seek its healers, hospitals, and restorative magic.

layers.name: Jovar
layers.description: Strewn with beautiful rubies and garnets, home to the seven-tiered Heavenly City.

notableLocations.name: Heavenly City
notableLocations.description: A seven-tiered city in the Glittering Heaven.

layers.name: Chronias
layers.description: An ineffable mystery.

environmentalEffects.name: Pervasive Goodness
environmentalEffects.description: The pervasive goodness of Mount Celestia bestows blessings on creatures on the plane.

adventureThemes: Proving worthiness
Forswearing selfishness, greed, and hatred
Defending against Fiend assaults
Evil's true foothold in visitors' hearts

planes.name: Negative Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Source of necrotic energy that destroys the living and animates the Undead. A needy, greedy plane sucking life from anything vulnerable.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: A lightless void without end. Only creatures immune to Necrotic damage can survive long.

temperature.description: Heat, fire, and life itself are drawn into the maw of this plane.

hazards.name: Life Drain
hazards.description: Merely entering the plane is comparable to the life-draining touch of a wraith. Only creatures with Immunity to Necrotic damage can survive for long.

hazards.name: Voidstones
hazards.description: In some locations, negative energy folds in on itself, stabilizing into solid chunks that devour light. Anything that comes into contact with a voidstone is destroyed in seconds. Thought to be the source of Spheres of Annihilation.

adventureThemes: Face-to-face confrontation with annihilation
Draining of vitality, energy, and happiness

planes.name: Nine Hells
planes.philosophicalEssence: The ultimate plane of law and evil, the epitome of premeditated cruelty. Devils are bound to obey laws of superiors but squabble within castes.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Temptation, corruption, and manipulation pervade every interaction.

temperature.description: Varies from fiery wastelands to frozen hellscapes.

layers.name: Avernus
layers.description: The Blood War rages across battlefields littered with corpses and wreckage. A rocky wasteland with rivers of blood and clouds of biting flies. Fiery comets fall from the darkened sky.

ruler.name: Zariel
ruler.title: Archduchess of Avernus
ruler.description: Appears as an angel whose skin and wings are scorched. Eyes burn with furious white light. Seat of power is a flying basalt citadel.

layers.name: Dis
layers.description: Iron roads in deep canyons lead to the dreaded Iron City of Dis. A labyrinth of canyons with mountains rich in iron ore.

notableLocations.name: Iron City of Dis
notableLocations.description: A hideous metropolis where planar travelers conspire with devils and close deals with Fiends.

ruler.name: Dispater
ruler.title: Archduke of Dis
ruler.description: A manipulator and deceiver, devilishly handsome. One of Asmodeus's most loyal and resourceful vassals.

layers.name: Minauros
layers.description: Acid falls like rain on putrid bogs and decaying cities. Cyclopean cities of ornately carved stone rise from the bog.

notableLocations.name: City of Minauros
notableLocations.description: Great city with slimy walls rising hundreds of feet, Mammon's lair piled high with treasures.

ruler.name: Mammon
ruler.title: Archduke of Minauros
ruler.description: Resembles a massive serpent with upper torso and head of a hairless, horned humanoid. Legendary greed; will trade favors for gold instead of souls.

layers.name: Phlegethos
layers.description: Obsidian fortresses bask in the heat of raging volcanoes and magma rivers.

notableLocations.name: Abriymoch
notableLocations.description: Fortress city of obsidian and dark glass within a volcanic caldera, with rivers of molten lava on its outer walls.

ruler.name: Belial
ruler.title: Archduke of Phlegethos
ruler.description: Rules in tandem with daughter Fierna. Both resemble tieflings with red skin and small horns. Their alliance is unbreakable.

layers.name: Stygia
layers.description: Levistus's prison is a frigid hellscape of jagged ice and cold fire. Frozen sea surrounded by gloomy sky crackling with lightning.

ruler.name: Levistus
ruler.title: Archduke of Stygia
ruler.description: Encased deep in ice as punishment for betraying Asmodeus. Rules telepathically with followers.

layers.name: Malbolge
layers.description: An ever-crumbling mountain threatens to bury visitors. A seemingly endless slope with crumbling fortresses and caves.

notableLocations.name: Osseia
notableLocations.description: Glasya's citadel on the slopes, supported by cracked pillars. Beneath it lies a labyrinth of cells and torture chambers.

ruler.name: Glasya
ruler.title: Archduchess of Malbolge
ruler.description: Asmodeus's daughter. Her cruelty and love of wicked schemes rival those of her father.

layers.name: Maladomini
layers.description: Swarms of hungry flies plague dead cities surrounded by utter desolation. A ruin-covered wasteland.

ruler.name: Baalzebul
ruler.title: Lord of Flies, Archduke of Maladomini
ruler.description: A tall, powerful devil with compound eyes of a fly. Long conspired to usurp Asmodeus. Cursed so any deal leads to calamity.

layers.name: Cania
layers.description: Ice-trapped cities provide shelter in a realm cold enough to freeze the soul. Ice storms can tear flesh from bone.

notableLocations.name: Mephistar
notableLocations.description: Ice citadel where Mephistopheles plots to seize the throne of the Nine Hells.

ruler.name: Mephistopheles
ruler.title: Archduke of Cania
ruler.description: Asmodeus's greatest enemy and ally. A tall, striking devil with impressive horns and cool demeanor. Only Asmodeus has ever deceived or thwarted him.

layers.name: Nessus
layers.description: Mighty fortresses stand watch over the deepest pits of the Nine Hells. A realm of dark pits with bleak fortresses.

notableLocations.name: Malsheem
notableLocations.description: A gigantic hollowed-out stalagmite rising from a vast rift. Home to Asmodeus and his infernal court. Also a prison for souls.

ruler.name: Asmodeus
ruler.title: Archduke of Nessus, Supreme Ruler of the Nine Hells
ruler.description: Most often appears as a handsome, bearded man with four large horns, piercing red eyes, and flowing robes. The most cunning and well-mannered of archdevils. Wields the power of a lesser god.

notableEntities.name: Asmodeus
notableEntities.title: Archduke of Nessus
notableEntities.description: Supreme ruler of all devils, wielding power of a lesser god.

notableEntities.name: Tiamat
notableEntities.title: Queen of Evil Dragons
notableEntities.description: A prisoner on Avernus, ruling her own domain but confined by Asmodeus.

specialRules.name: No Direct Lower Layer Portals
specialRules.description: By Asmodeus's orders, no planar portals connect directly to the lower layers of the Nine Hells. Avernus is the arrival point for visitors.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: All visitors must arrive at Avernus (layer 1) and descend through each layer. The River Styx is the most expeditious means.

adventureThemes: Journey into the heart of evil
Resisting manipulation, deceit, and treachery
Temptation to fulfill deepest longings
Discovery that one's own heart isn't immune to corruption

planes.name: Outlands
planes.philosophicalEssence: The plane of neutrality, keeping all aspects of the planes in paradoxical balance—simultaneously concordant and in opposition.

physicalProperties.shape: A great disk with sixteen gate-towns evenly spaced around the outside edge.
physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Varied terrain with prairies, mountains, and shallow rivers.

domainsOrRegions.name: Automata
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Mechanus.

domainsOrRegions.name: Bedlam
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Pandemonium.

domainsOrRegions.name: Curst
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Carceri.

domainsOrRegions.name: Ecstasy
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Elysium.

domainsOrRegions.name: Excelsior
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Mount Celestia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Faunel
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Beastlands.

domainsOrRegions.name: Fortitude
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Arcadia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Glorium
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Ysgard.

domainsOrRegions.name: Hopeless
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Hades.

domainsOrRegions.name: Plague-Mort
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to the Abyss.

domainsOrRegions.name: Ribcage
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Nine Hells.

domainsOrRegions.name: Rigus
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Acheron.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sylvania
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Arborea.

domainsOrRegions.name: Torch
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Gehenna.

domainsOrRegions.name: Tradegate
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Bytopia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Xaos
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Limbo.

adventureThemes: Conflicts between opposing planar influences
Celestial spies and Fiend assassins
Preserving nature's balance from extremes

crossReferences.description: Includes extensive information on the Outlands.

planes.name: Pandemonium
planes.philosophicalEssence: Overwhelming chaos, cold, noisy, and dark. The howling winds bring everyone to the edge of lashing out, despair, or incoherence.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Incessant winds push visitors to frustration, despair, or dissolution.

physicalProperties.shape: A great mass of rock riddled with tunnels carved by howling winds.
physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Constant howling winds of varying intensity.

layers.name: Pandesmos
layers.description: Howling winds, dark streams bound for the River Styx, and blowing snow pour through vast, desolate caverns.

layers.name: Cocytus
layers.description: Winds blowing through narrower tunnels create a stronger force and louder wails.

notableLocations.name: Howler's Crag
notableLocations.description: A jagged spike rumored to have a unique magical property: anything yelled from the top is said to find the ears of its intended recipient, carried on a shrieking frigid wind, no matter where in the multiverse that person might be.

layers.name: Phlegethon
layers.description: Tunnel walls absorb light while water creates intricate rock formations.

layers.name: Agathion
layers.description: Sealed-off tunnels are largely inaccessible from elsewhere, making them ideal as vaults for ancient secrets.

hazards.name: Howling Winds
hazards.description: Wind quickly extinguishes nonmagical open flames such as torches and campfires. Makes conversation possible only by yelling, and even then only to a maximum distance of 10 feet. No natural light exists on the plane.

effectOnConversation.reason: Howling winds drown out all sound beyond 10 feet.

adventureThemes: What happens on characters' worst day
Everything goes wrong and the wind won't let up
Frustration without transferring it to players

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ash
planes.philosophicalEssence: Movement and change given a destructive tone by raging conflagration.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Thick ash obscures sight. Battering winds.
physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Endless storm of flames, smoke, and ash.

adventureThemes: Interaction between air and fire
Movement and change with destructive tone

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ice

temperature.description: Seemingly endless glacier swept by constant, raging blizzards.

adventureThemes: Proving strength and survival

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ooze
planes.philosophicalEssence: Contrast between stable earth and flowing water. Objects cast in can't be found for at least a century.
adventureThemes: Seeking powerful Artifacts cast into the swamp
Braving monstrous insects and hags

planes.name: Positive Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Source of radiant energy and raw life force. A continual furnace of creation, a domain of brilliance.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Every bit glows brightly with innate power. Only creatures immune to Radiant damage can survive.

temperature.description: Like the heart of a star.

hazards.name: Overwhelming Radiance
hazards.description: This power is dangerous to mortal forms, which can't handle it for long. Only creatures that have Immunity to Radiant damage can survive there.

adventureThemes: Vibrant life and creative energy
Lasting charge making it hard to calm down or sleep
Persistent resistance to disease and despair

planes.name: Shadowfell
planes.philosophicalEssence: A gloomy dimension of death, gloom, and dread. Distorted mirror of the Material Plane.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Melancholic atmosphere pervading extended forays, leading to despair.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Black vault sky with neither sun nor stars.

hazards.name: Shadowfell Despair
hazards.description: When the DM deems it appropriate (usually not more than once per day), a character not from the Shadowfell makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, roll d6 for despair effect. New despair replaces old. After a Long Rest, DC 15 Wisdom save to overcome. Calm Emotions or curse removal cures it.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: When the DM deems it appropriate, usually not more than once per day. Character must not be from the Shadowfell.

onFailure.description: Roll d6: 1-3 Apathy (Disadvantage on Death Saves and Initiative), 4-5 Dread (Disadvantage on all saving throws), 6 Delusion (Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws using Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma).

entries.durationDescription: Until cured. Disadvantage on Death Saving Throws and Initiative rolls.
Until cured. Disadvantage on all saving throws.
Until cured. Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws that use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

requirement.description: Form in gloomy places where spirits or stench of death lingers (battlefields, graveyards, tombs). Manifest only in darkness, closing as soon as they feel light's kiss.

domainsOrRegions.name: Barovia
domainsOrRegions.description: The towering spires of Castle Ravenloft loom above the valley of Barovia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Borca
domainsOrRegions.description: Amid opulent estates and impoverished villages, two Darklords pursue obsessive schemes.

domainsOrRegions.name: Falkovnia
domainsOrRegions.description: Empty countryside surrounds crumbling cities fighting a losing battle against endless zombies.

domainsOrRegions.name: Kalakeri
domainsOrRegions.description: A beautiful land where three royal heirs—transformed into monsters—battle endlessly for the throne.

domainsOrRegions.name: Lamordia
domainsOrRegions.description: Inventors and scholars violate natural and moral laws in frozen bogs and glacial expanses.

domainsOrRegions.name: Mordent
domainsOrRegions.description: The realm of ghost stories and hauntings. Death heralds a haunted afterlife as a restless spirit.

domainsOrRegions.name: Valachan
domainsOrRegions.description: The devious hunter Chakuna roams the jungles, drawing people into fatal contests.

adventureThemes: Encounters with Undead
Explorations of distorted mirror-landscapes
Descents into Domains of Dread
Horror around every corner

crossReferences.description: Domains of Dread described in more detail.

planes.name: Sigil, City of Doors
planes.philosophicalEssence: A bustling planar metropolis holding countless portals to other planes and worlds. A trader's paradise.

physicalProperties.shape: A ring-shaped city floating above the Spire at the center of the Outlands. Structures built on the ring's inner surface.

notableEntities.name: Lady of Pain
notableEntities.title: Ruler of Sigil
notableEntities.description: An inscrutable being whose purpose and goals are unknown. Appears almost human with ornate robes and a mantle of blades coated in blue-green verdigris surrounding her masklike face. Widely accepted as a being on par with deities.

adventureThemes: Trading information about the planes
Finding portal commands and key items
Interplanar commerce and intrigue

planes.name: Ysgard
planes.philosophicalEssence: Glory earned through heroic deeds in battle. Euphoria of an athlete, exhilaration of a summer storm, triumphant celebration.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Heroic battle-glory; the horrors of war are overlooked in favor of glory.

temperature.description: Long hot summers, cold unforgiving winters.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Windswept, with floating continents above volcanic rock oceans.

layers.name: Ysgard
layers.description: Immense rivers of floating earth grind together in eternal rumbling. Soaring mountains, deep fjords, windswept battlefields.

notableLocations.name: Plain of Ida
notableLocations.description: Daily festivals let warriors and athletes show off their bravery and skill.

layers.name: Muspelheim
layers.description: The ground smokes and burns beneath the earthbergs of the top layer.

layers.name: Nidavellir
layers.description: Floating chunks of earth are closer together, giving the appearance of endless tunnels with rich mineral deposits.

resurrectionRule.requirement: Must be killed in combat while on Ysgard.

adventureThemes: Lighthearted combat without consequences
Proving mettle against epic foes
Daily festivals on the Plain of Ida
Secrets buried in deep caverns

globalPlanarConnections.name: Infinite Staircase
globalPlanarConnections.description: An extradimensional staircase that connects the planes. Entrances appear as nondescript doors. Changes appearance as it climbs and descends. Home to Nafas, a noble genie created by planar winds. Doors are often tucked away in dusty, half-forgotten places.

globalPlanarConnections.name: River Oceanus
globalPlanarConnections.description: Sweet and fragrant water with headwaters in Elysium's lowest layer (Thalasia). Flows through each of Elysium's layers, the top layer of the Beastlands, and the top layer of Arborea, draining in Arborea's second layer. A commonly used path with trading vessels and small towns.

globalPlanarConnections.name: River Styx
globalPlanarConnections.description: Bubbles with grease, foul flotsam, and putrid remains. Churns through the top layers of the Lower Planes with tributaries snaking through lower layers. Sinister ferries crewed by pilots skilled in navigating the currents carry passengers for a price.

globalPlanarConnections.name: Yggdrasil, the World Tree
globalPlanarConnections.description: A cosmic ash tree spanning the Outer Planes and linking them to Material Plane worlds. Roots stretch into the Lower Planes. Trunk rises through Ysgard. Branches stretch through Upper Planes and across the Astral to the Material Plane.

bloodWar.description: Throughout history, the teeming demon hordes of the Abyss and the regimented legions of devils from the Nine Hells have battled for supremacy in the cosmos. The conflict has raged for millennia, ravaging the Lower Planes. A moment never goes by when demons and devils aren't battling each other somewhere in the multiverse.

factions.name: Demon Hordes
factions.role: Teeming chaotic forces seeking to overwhelm through numbers and ferocity.

factions.name: Devil Legions
factions.role: Regimented legions fighting with discipline and strategy.

bloodWar.adventureImplications: Powerful mortal adventurers are sometimes drawn into tangled schemes. Open conflict between Fiends is a constant threat on most Lower Planes. Natives of Upper Planes stand ready to intervene when the Blood War spills outside the Abyss and Nine Hells.

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Portals
planarTravelMethods.description: Stationary interplanar connections linking specific locations. Some function like doorways, others are locations existing on multiple planes. Requirements may include command words, key items, random timing, situational conditions, or specific times.
risks: Requirements may be difficult to learn or meet

planarTravelMethods.name: Spells
planarTravelMethods.description: Spells allow direct or indirect access to different planes of existence.

planarTravelMethods.name: The Dream of Other Worlds
planarTravelMethods.description: Aided by magic, travelers can fall into a deep slumber and dream themselves into a new realm.
destinations: Other worlds of the Material Plane

planarTravelMethods.name: The Great Journey
planarTravelMethods.description: An epic voyage through Wildspace and across the Astral Plane aboard a vessel powered by magic. Also possible through the Shadowfell or Feywild.
destinations: Other worlds of the Material Plane

planarTravelMethods.name: The Leap to Another Realm
planarTravelMethods.description: Using spells such as Teleportation Circle or Teleport, or magical portals. Causes the user to appear in a known teleportation circle or other location in another world.
destinations: Other worlds of the Material Plane

planarTravelMethods.name: The Roots of the Worlds
planarTravelMethods.description: Nexus points are locations existing in multiple worlds simultaneously, often near where seedlings of the First World's great tree took root. Can be geographic features or constructed features. Some flit from world to world on a schedule.
requirements: May require magic, an object from the destination world, or just an act of will
destinations: Other worlds of the Material Plane

planarAdventureSituations.situation: When magic fails to revive a dead person, the only solution is to venture to the Outer Planes to find the person's spirit and either release it from some prison or convince the person to return to life.

People who venture into the woods keep accidentally wandering into the Feywild or the Shadowfell. They might never return, return with no sense of how much time has passed, or return dramatically changed.
A long-dead oracle is the only one who knows how a terrible prophecy might be averted, but the cataclysmic fulfillment of the prophecy has already begun.
A god has stopped answering prayers and won't respond to any Commune spell.
A devil has tricked an angel into meddling in the Blood War, and the angel seeks mortal aid.
An ancestor of one of the characters must be convinced to bless the character before the full power of the character's bloodline can be unleashed.
A foolhardy knight carried a holy weapon on a doomed mission into the Nine Hells, and the powers of Mount Celestia want the weapon and the knight's remains retrieved.
A titan is imprisoned on an Outer Plane. The characters might be trying to stop those who seek to release it, or they might want to release it to help defend the world from a greater threat.

To prove themselves worthy of an even greater quest, the characters are sent to slay a horrible monster, win the favor of a powerful planar being, negotiate peace between two warring planar factions, or retrieve a long-lost item on another plane.
An item of legend is being sold at auction in Sigil, the City of Brass, or some other planar metropolis.

globalPlanarDissonance.description: Celestials who visit the Lower Planes and Fiends who visit the Upper Planes experience significant discomfort if their visits last more than a few hours. After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to its nature, a Celestial or Fiend makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save and ends when the creature finishes a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to its nature.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to its nature.

onFailure.description: Whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, it must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: Each failed save adds an additional 1d4 subtracted from D20 Tests.

recoveryMethods: Finish a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to its nature

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
